similarities: Strong self-control and focus on personal boundaries
Desire for autonomy and maintaining personal integrity
differences: Sp8 seeks control to avoid vulnerability and maintain power; driven by a fear of being controlled or harmed.
Sp1 seeks control to maintain moral purity; driven by a fear of being wrong or corrupt.

similarities: Image-conscious and socially dominant
Desire to maintain influence in group settings
differences: So8 asserts power to control social dynamics and uphold justice; fears losing power or appearing weak.
So3 adapts to gain recognition and status; fears worthlessness and failure to meet external expectations.

similarities: Intense relational styles with loyalty or defiance in close bonds
Protective of loved ones and sensitive to betrayal
differences: Sx8 asserts dominance to control intimacy and prevent betrayal; fears vulnerability.
Sx6 oscillates between devotion and defiance due to fear of abandonment; driven by insecurity and a need for reassurance.

similarities: Low energy outwardly, prioritizing personal space and comfort
Withdrawing tendencies to preserve inner stability
differences: Sp9 withdraws to maintain inner peace and avoid conflict; fears disruption and loss of comfort.
Sp5 withdraws to conserve resources and energy; fears depletion and incompetence.

similarities: Group-oriented and relationship-focused
Prioritize maintaining harmony in social settings
differences: So9 minimizes personal needs to preserve group peace; fears conflict and disconnection.
So2 actively seeks validation by helping others to secure their place in the group; fears rejection and being unneeded.

similarities: Desire for deep emotional connection and idealized relationships
Struggle with self-expression in intimate bonds
differences: Sx9 diffuses their identity and merges with others to maintain peace; fears separation and conflict.
Sx4 intensifies emotional experiences and expresses longing for uniqueness; fears abandonment and being misunderstood.

similarities: Cautious, responsible, and focused on maintaining order
Strong inner critic and tendency toward anxiety
differences: Sp1 channels anxiety into self-discipline and moral regulation; fears being corrupt or flawed.
Sp6 channels anxiety into preparedness and loyalty; fears uncertainty and insecurity.

similarities: Desire to correct or protect others in group contexts
Strong presence in social environments
differences: So1 enforces moral standards to create an ideal environment; fears moral failure and disorder.
So8 enforces power dynamics to protect themselves and others; fears being controlled or disempowered.

similarities: Caregiving tendencies and desire to be needed
Difficulty expressing personal needs directly
differences: Sp2 provides support quietly to feel secure in relationships; fears being unloved or unwanted.
Sx2 expresses care intensely to secure intimacy; fears rejection and emotional abandonment.

similarities: Goal-oriented and focused on maintaining personal security
Concern with maintaining a positive self-image
differences: Sp3 achieves through efficiency and image management to avoid feelings of inadequacy.
Sp7 plans for pleasurable experiences and future security to avoid discomfort and restriction.

similarities: Sociable and focused on external validation or group perception
Tendency to adapt to social expectations
differences: So3 seeks success and recognition to validate self-worth; fears being seen as a failure.
So7 seeks inspiration and positivity to avoid pain and limitation; fears missing out or emotional suffering.

similarities: Emphasis on self-expression and identity in close relationships
Desire for admiration or emotional intensity
differences: Sx3 shapes their image to attract admiration and avoid insignificance.
Sx4 amplifies emotional authenticity to avoid feeling ordinary or abandoned.

similarities: Self-sufficient, withdrawn from emotional entanglements
Highly resistant to being controlled or overwhelmed
differences: Sp5 controls by withdrawing and minimizing needs; fears depletion and incompetence.
Sp8 controls by confronting and dominating their space; fears vulnerability and being harmed.

similarities: Assertive and energetic when pursuing personal goals
Seek freedom and self-governance
differences: Sp8 asserts power to secure safety and independence; driven by fear of vulnerability.
Sp7 seeks options and stimulation to avoid pain and restriction; driven by fear of deprivation.

similarities: Group-focused with protective tendencies
Concerned with being seen as valuable or influential
differences: So8 leads through strength and confrontation to maintain justice and respect.
So2 leads through support and strategic care to feel irreplaceable and needed.

similarities: Intense relational focus and strong emotional expression
Protective or possessive in close relationships
differences: Sx8 uses intensity to guard intimacy and assert control; fears betrayal and loss of power.
Sx2 uses intensity to secure love and be indispensable; fears emotional rejection.

similarities: Driven to connect and be needed
Can become emotionally manipulative to maintain bonds
differences: So2 focuses on public care and social bonding to secure appreciation; fears irrelevance in the group.
Sx2 intensifies emotional closeness in private relationships to earn devotion; fears abandonment.

similarities: Rule-following, responsible, and self-critical
Driven by duty and concern for correctness
differences: Sp1 internalizes standards and aims for personal perfection; fears moral failure.
So6 externalizes safety through loyal adherence to systems; fears betrayal and instability.

similarities: Identity-focused, emotionally sensitive, and idealistic
Feel misunderstood or different
differences: So4 idealizes a social role or archetype and experiences public longing; fears being unremarkable or invisible.
Sx4 intensifies emotional connection and seeks recognition in intimate bonds; fears being unloved or abandoned.

similarities: Energetic, goal-oriented, and concerned with how others perceive them
Adaptive and socially competent
differences: So3 is motivated by the need for validation through visible success and admiration; fears being worthless or unimpressive.
Sp7 is motivated by the need to avoid pain and limitation through planning and private enjoyment; fears deprivation and being trapped.

similarities: Highly image-aware, focused on being appreciated and valued by others
Motivated by external feedback
differences: So2 gains value by being helpful, nurturing, and needed; fears being rejected or unloved.
So3 gains value by being impressive, competent, and admired; fears failure or being seen as inadequate.

similarities: Charismatic, people-oriented, and enthusiastic
Concerned with being liked and staying connected
differences: So2 uses charm and service to gain affection and relational safety; fears disapproval and being unnecessary.
So7 uses charm and positivity to maintain freedom and avoid pain; fears being trapped in suffering or emotional heaviness.

similarities: Intense in relationships, focused on winning othersâ€™ affection
Charismatic, seductive, and emotionally engaging
differences: Sx2 seeks fusion and emotional dependence to feel irreplaceable; fears abandonment and rejection.
Sx7 seeks excitement and stimulation in connection, but avoids deep vulnerability; fears being consumed or bored.
